reviews.review_msg: good prof. he explains the requirements for assignments and lab reports clearly and welcomes questions or suggestions. he opens opportunities to choose labs that you are interested in. this course is not hard if you prepared well before each lab and take time to write the report.
Dr. Alberding is so helpful and he is so funny. If you ask for  help, he is more than happy to assist you but you might end up spending lots of time in his office b/c he is hilarious..

really nice guy in the lab courses.  believes in giving good grades, unlike a lot of other profs in the department.  would take a class again with him.  a bit crazy and disorganised, but entertainingly so.
great in the lab, helpless in lecture.

She was alright. She generally seemed to want to help, and she tried to teach you lab procedures. Her lessons were kind of useless though. She marks the final summaries for the class, and gives you feedback before the final grading. Even if you fix everything she gives feedback on though, she just finds more unrelated stuff to deduct marks on.
Tries to teach actual lab skills. Semester was cut short though.

Very restrict about everything in the lab, and he would ask too many questions so you would fail at some point. Focuses more on the theory than the experiment. Not very helpful if you need help with the lab.
